name: Cannoli Contest Entry
description:
This is my entry for the cannoli contest for DIYorDIE. Before this contest I've never tried a real cannoli, but after having about 10 in the past two weeks, this is my best attempt at nailing the profile. Straight up cannoli. No lemon or chocolate just pastry and filling. Thanks for making me gain a few pounds, Wayne!

This was only able to steep for a week, but even with just a week steep it's good. I feel that letting it steep longer than a week will definitely benefit this recipe.
author: Goldfish18

reviews.text: Maybe this recipe just isn't for me or the way I vape but I couldn't enjoy it at all. It smelled very nice in the bottle, just like cannolis, but the flavor was muted as if I was using an old wick on a dirty coil.

I feel like age may have gotten to this recipe. Could've been fit for flavor-dull tanks of the past, but I don't personally think it holds up. Felt muted and dirty, and that's from a clean coil. Was partially creamy, but couldn't hold up as something I actually wanted to finish.
Despite the age of this recipe, it still works! Nice solid buttery cinnamon taste. I each for this a few times a week when I really want to indulge myself. Good stuff!
looooove this recipe
Fantastic recipe! Light, crisp, vanilla goodness. All day vape forsure.
not too bad
Very good thank you !
Very tasty!
One of the first mix i did on ATF, and wow. It is so rich and sooo freaking yummy. Thanks for this.
Excellent job will be mixing another batch of this
My new favourite adv. Thankyou for sharing this is absolutely delicious!

Really great recipe. Nailed the profile perfectly for me. Great mouthfeel, fluffy, and not overly sweet with the perfect amount of pastry. I want to add some sort of fruit "compote" to this but it's just so perfect as is.
Thick, rich, tasty,and great with morning coffee!  Very nice
Absolutely delicious. Mixed this a couple of weeks ago and finished it in a couple of days. Will have to mix it again. Cheers!
Delicious cannoli. Well done!
This is one of my favorite DIY recipes. Perfect blend of ingredients, and it doesn't give me vape tongue. I love it so much that I just mixed up 360mL of it.

being a person that has never had an actual cannoli I can't really comment on how well you nailed the profile. What I can say is that this is a delicious recipe! Well balanced, perfectly sweetened and a great addition to my regular rotation of 60mls. I'm not a big fan of Tfa Bavarian cream but you made me reconsider how to use it in a recipe. Thanks Goldbones

Been vaping this one since the contest and I still go back to it time and time again. The simplicity is what makes this one beautiful. The base is perfectly creamy. The small amount of cheesecake added to the custard certainly mimics the mascarpone that you would find in an authentic Cannoli. I rarely ever go more than .5% with Biscuit, but it adds that snap to the sugar cookie that makes an excellent shell note to this juice. I thought this was the clear winner out of all the contest entries. Great job.

This is a very straightforward cannoli. Great balance in ingredients, ans a smooth vape. Definitely needs at least 6, or 7 days steep, but gets creamier, and more homogeneous each additional day. The limitation of only 6 ingredients makes this even more impressive. I definitely swiped this base, and added some more fatty/creamy notes. The only thing it might lack for some is that overwhelming tangy creaminess of a cannoli. Otherwise a very impressive recipe overall. Thanks for sharing.
